intro: Libinhania discolor, commonly known as the yellow-flowered pterostigma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive dark purple disc in the center. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
